page.title: 17GLENIFFER BRAES COUNTRY PARK
page.content: The park employs 3 gardeners and 2 Rangers and we asked one of them, Mrs Hoey to tell us more about the park. The area is an ancient lava flow overlying sandstone. There are 2 quarries in the park, but that is the only industry. The park is well used for leisure and has regular visits from schools. There is a 30 foot high waterfall in the park but it is not always in full flow because the stream that feeds it is the overflow from a reservoir further upstream. Brownside Farm belongs to the Lamont family but unfortuneately they moved out a couple of months ago. The council is taking it over and they are going to make it into a study centre for the park. Some of the land may also be taken over by the golf course. Mrs Howie also told us that the park is now well used for orienteering.
